results.content: All I want to learn from this course is how to use Netbeans. At the time I bought the course, he is the only one that is offering to teach Java using the Netbeans IDE. All of the rest I have seen are either using Eclipse or BlueJay which is not the tool we use at work. He can get a little fast but there is the rewind button so all is good.

results.content: Recommended for Java beginners. Very well structured and can be also used to refresh old skills. The videos could be in a better quality, but the instructor speaks loud and clear and its easy to follow. Thanks for the greate course.
results.content_html: Recommended for Java beginners. Very well structured and can be also used to refresh old skills. The videos could be in a better quality, but the instructor speaks loud and clear and its easy to follow. Thanks for the greate course.

results.content: Tom is easy to follow and covers a wide variety of topics that every beginning Java programmer should know. I took this course to freshen up on programming in Java .I learned so much more in these lectures, then I ever did in both my Intro and Intermediate Java classes  in college.
results.content_html: Tom is easy to follow and covers a wide variety of topics that every beginning Java programmer should know. I took this course to freshen up on programming in Java .I learned so much more in these lectures, then I ever did in both my Intro and Intermediate Java classes in college.

results.content: My only "critical" observation would be that Tom often sounded as though he was in a rush, even bored with his own lecturing. He even admits across several videos that he had a "long day". Well, OK, fine. We don't need to know. We're here to learn, not feel sorry for the instructor. Other than that, I appreciate the instruction on using NetBeans...the debugger especially. Trying to learn OOP is challenging for me, and I have a decent handle on most of the things. Seems that Udemy lacks engaging and helpful Java courses. John Purcell's courses appear to be the only comparable content.

results.content: Very in depth. I like that there is no time wasted. Straight to the point.
